cyclone.name: KAY
cyclone.current_location: about 340 miles south of the southern tip of the Baja California peninsula
cyclone.trajectory: Moving northwest today, then turning north-northwest Wednesday-Friday while paralleling the Baja California coastline and then curving westward south of southern California late Saturday–Sunday.

weather_observation.watch_coast: Tropical-storm watch for the east coast of Baja California from San Evaristo to Santa Rosalia and west coast from Cabo San Lázaro to Punta Abreojos
weather_observation.warning_coast: Tropical-storm warning for San Evaristo southward to Cabo San Lucas and Cabo San Lucas northward to Cabo San Lázaro
weather_observation.impacted_coast: Entire Baja California peninsula and coastal waters extending north toward southern California
weather_observation.wind: Very low (≈3%) chance of sustained tropical-storm-force winds late Friday through Saturday; most likely winds remain below gale force.
weather_observation.storm_surge: None anticipated for the Long Beach inner harbor; minor coastal run-up possible on open beaches.
weather_observation.rainfall: Outer moisture plume could bring 0.5–2 inches of rain to coastal southern California Friday-Saturday with localized flooding.
weather_observation.other_hazards: Large long-period swells producing high surf, beach erosion and dangerous rip currents Friday through the weekend.
